result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Cortez Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to Anoka County Sentence.
Defendant to report to Probation today May 11, 2015 by 11:00 a.m.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
Defendant is entitled to 1 day credit under 973.155.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to:

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.

-DNA sample.
-Complete current treatment successfully.
-Cooperate with any evaluation, assessment and/or correctional program as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Bryce Brown.
-Maintain full-time employment.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Pay Supervision fees.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  Kirk Anderson   DF:  Mario Cortez Jackson appeared. Case called at 10:03 an, Court reviews file. Atty Anderson makes statement. Parties make sentencing arguements.  Defendant makes statement. Court orders 3 years probation sentence w/h with conditions:
- 7 months Condition Time, 4 months STAYED. Work release for work and treatment. Consecutive to Anoka County Sentence. May serve in Anoka County at no contact in St. Croix County.
- Court Costs. Apply money on file
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Complete current treatment successful
- Cooperate with any evaluation assessment and/or correctional program as directed by DOC. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No contact with B. Brown
- Maintain Employment
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Sign up for probation by 11:00 am on 5/11/2015. Probation may be transferred to MN
- Credit for 1 Day
- Consecutive to Anoka County Sentence
